name: df-assa
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(casa, crab(s0, cin(clmod, crg), wsbc(s1, cfv(csca, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), ccrg), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), wral(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wral(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s5, cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), wsbc(s6, cfv(cmulr, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(co(co(cv(s2), cv(s5), cv(s3)), cv(s6), cv(s4)), co(cv(s2), cv(s5), co(cv(s3), cv(s6), cv(s4)))), wceq(co(cv(s3), cv(s6), co(cv(s2), cv(s5), cv(s4))), co(cv(s2), cv(s5), co(cv(s3), cv(s6), cv(s4))))))))))))))
comment: Definition of an associative algebra. An associative algebra is a set equipped with a left-module structure on a (commutative) ring, coupled with a multiplicative internal operation on the vectors of the module that is associative and distributive for the additive structure of the left-module (so giving the vectors a ring structure) and that is also bilinear under the scalar product. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)
